definition: to talk sb round/to straighten sth out/to enlighten

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct

sentences.english: Let me enlighten those who haven't been to that exotic part of the archipelago .
sentences.chinese: 让我开导这些谁没有得到这一奇特的一部分，该群岛。

sentences.english: Are victims suffer indignities hiding in the room, comfort and channel is d. rosy clouds come in.
sentences.chinese: 正婷受气躲在房里，彩霞进来安慰并开导正婷。

sentences.english: Under the instructions of the psychologist, his psychological problem of a double personality has been appropriately treated.
sentences.chinese: 开导下，他的双重人格心理障碍得到了适度的调整。

sentences.english: Thank you, really very enlightened me before grateful to you.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你之前开导我，真的很感激你。

sentences.english: Guys weren’t supposed to get you to open up.
I know you've done a lot of work on this with Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 我知道莱西夫人以前开导过你很多关于这方面的事。

sentences.english: Seek the blessings and guidance of a higher authority and they might just show you the right path.
sentences.chinese: 向长辈寻求开导和指引吧，或许你能茅塞顿开。

sentences.english: I know you’ve done a lot of work on this with Mrs. Lacey.
sentences.chinese: 我知道莱西夫人以前开导过你很多关于这方面的事。

definition: to straighten out/to explain/to ease sb's anxiety
to mediate/to reconcile/to make peace/to intervene
earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently
to soothe/to pacify/to mollify/to mediate (in a dispute etc)
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
